snippet: The health care giant reported earnings of $3.8 billion in the second quarter, aided in part by the sale of the company’s stake in Elan of Ireland.
abstract: Johnson & Johnson reports second-quarter profit of $3.8 billion, or $1.33 a share, more than doubling $1.41 billion, or 50 cents a share, during year-ago quarter; revenue rose 8.5 percent to $17.9 billion.
lead_paragraph: The health care giant reported earnings of $3.8 billion in the second quarter, aided in part by the sale of the company’s stake in Elan of Ireland.

headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Profit Rises on Strong Prescription Sales
headline.print_headline: Strong Sales Underpin Earnings At J.&J.
